title: Vinyl Sales Hit Highest Level Since 1987 — Thanks to Gen Z
shortdescription: Taylor Swift, Harry Styles, and Olivia Rodrigo drive vinyl revival among 18-24 year olds.
author: Alex Rivera

content.content: /images/Vinyl Sales Hit Highest Level Since 1987 — Thanks to Gen Z.webp
The RIAA just dropped jaw-dropping numbers: 2025 has officially become the biggest year for vinyl sales since 1987, with over 58 million units sold in the U.S. alone — and Gen Z is the driving force.
For the first time ever, listeners aged 18–24 now account for 46% of all physical vinyl purchases, surpassing millennials and boomers combined.
Taylor, Harry & Olivia Lead the Charge

Taylor Swift remains the undisputed queen of vinyl, moving 4.8 million units across The Tortured Poets Department (with 12 different colored variants) and re-recorded albums. Harry Styles’ Harry’s House deluxe marble pressing and Olivia Rodrigo’s GUTS (Spilled) blood-red edition both sold out in under 10 minutes.
Limited-edition colored vinyl, signed inserts, and aesthetic gatefolds have turned records into collectible art pieces for Gen Z — many of whom discovered vinyl through TikTok unboxing videos.

Independent record stores report their highest foot traffic ever, while Urban Outfitters and Target have become top vinyl retailers. Analysts predict 2026 could finally push vinyl past 70 million units — a level not seen since the height of Michael Jackson and Madonna.
